meanings.definition: A social organization for male college students.
meanings.sent1: Many students at the university are members of frats.
meanings.sent2: The frat hosted a charity event for the community.
meanings.sent3: The frat brothers organized a fun game night.
meanings.sent4: Being part of a frat is like having a big family in college.
meanings.sent5: The history of frats dates back to the early 19th century.

meanings.definition: To join or participate in a fraternity.
meanings.sent1: He decided to frats with his friends to make lasting memories.
meanings.sent2: She will frats with the sorority to meet new people.
meanings.sent3: They plan to frats together to support each other in college.
meanings.sent4: Fratsing in a brotherhood brings a sense of belonging.
meanings.sent5: I always wanted to frats and experience the camaraderie.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'frat', meaning a fraternity.
meanings.sent1: The campus has several frats, each with its own traditions.
meanings.sent2: Students often visit different frats during rush week.
meanings.sent3: The frats on campus have unique symbols and colors.
meanings.sent4: Joining multiple frats can be overwhelming for some students.
meanings.sent5: The frats' houses are known for their lively parties.
